intro: Agalmyla glabrisepala, commonly known as the smooth-sepaled agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with smooth, white petals. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a glossy texture. Agalmyla glabrisepala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
